Line 47: Line 47:
On July 11, 1924, Fish found eight-year-old Beatrice Kiel playing alone on her parents' [[Staten Island]] farm. He offered her money to come and help him look for [[rhubarb]] in the neighboring fields. She was about to leave the farm when her mother chased Fish away. Fish left, but returned later to the Kiels' [[barn]] where he tried to sleep for the night before being discovered by Hans Kiel and told to leave.
On July 11, 1924, Fish found eight-year-old Beatrice Kiel playing alone on her parents' [[Staten Island]] farm. He offered her money to come and help him look for [[rhubarb]] in the neighboring fields. She was about to leave the farm when her mother chased Fish away. Fish left, but returned later to the Kiels' [[barn]] where he tried to sleep for the night before being discovered by Hans Kiel and told to leave.
â   â
It was on June 16, 1925, Fish found his most compelling victim, a Muslim girl by the name Lana Halim. It was this encounter that made Fish realise he indeed wasn't the biggest freak. In fact it was Halim who victimise, degraded and over all dehumanised Fish. In one of his many journal entries Fish wrote "when the she-devil forced me to dress in a ridiculously small sailors outfit, she knows no bounds to her weird behaviour. I have not only met my match but I have learnt indeed the devil lives amongst us".
